result.execSummary:
The defendant Kasandra L Wildt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bail applied to Costs/Surcharge.  Paid in full.  Remainder of bail to be refunded to poster.
Straight time.  Sentence credit for 6 days were granted.  TIME SERVED.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: March 28, 2016

Defendant Kasandra L Wildt in court, in custody, with attorney Adam Galaviz.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Galaviz makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. Court reinstates the $500.00 bail. 
The Court Orders the Following to count #1
6 days jail, credit of 6 days, TIME SERVED. 
COSTS: $243.00 apply bail
DNA Surcharge: $200.00 apply bail
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
